DataElement.preferredName: Or Adverse Event Product Problem Safety Report Document Version Number Text ISO21090.ST.SIMPLE.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A report that provides notification of an adverse event, product problem, and/or information that is relevant to either. A report typically includes causal association, management strategies, authorship, sender/receiver organizations, subject or study subject of adverse event, or name of product. EXAMPLE(S): An Expedited AE report - a report of a serious and unexpected adverse event that must be submitted within specific timeframes to the sponsor and regulatory agencies. A character string that identifies a given collection of content of a document at a point in time. EXAMPLE(S): Could be an integer starting at 1, incrementing by 1, with version number incremented by 1 when a version is replaced, but can also be incremented more often to meet local requirements. NOTE(S): Different versions of same document belong to same document group. Over time, there may be multiple changes to document; allows capture of relationships between changes in instances of document over time; can be new version every time content changes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Or Adverse Event Product Problem Safety Report Document Version Number Text
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.:The state of being certain that adverse effects will not be caused by some agent under defined conditions.:A short textual account; having provided a short account.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:Text; the words of something written.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Or Adverse Event Product Problem Safety Report Document Version
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.:The state of being certain that adverse effects will not be caused by some agent under defined conditions.:A short textual account; having provided a short account.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.
The state of being certain that adverse effects will not be caused by some agent under defined conditions.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader
